definitions.definition: To stop with a plug; to make tight by stopping a hole.
examples: He attempted to plug the leaks with some caulk.

definitions.definition: To promote (something, especially a product or service); to mention (something) as if promoting or advertising it.
examples: The main guest on the show just kept plugging his latest movie: it got so tiresome.
Kennedy went on nationwide speaking tour to plug environmental conservation.

definitions.definition: To persist or continue with something.
examples: Keep plugging at the problem until you find a solution.

definitions.definition: To have sex with; to penetrate sexually .
examples: I’d love to plug him with my strap-on.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To stop with a plug; to make tight by stopping a hole.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To promote (something, especially a product or service); to mention (something) as if promoting or advertising it.
( intransitive , informal ) To persist or continue with something.
( transitive , slang ) To shoot (someone) with a bullet .
( transitive , slang ) To have sex with; to penetrate sexually .
( transitive , slang ) To ingest a drug rectally .
